title: 105_hr4093
content: The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" is cited as the short title. It establishes a standard relating to hospital lengths of stay for group health plans under the Public Health Service Act. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" requires group health plans to provide inpatient coverage for a medically appropriate period determined by a physician. It prohibits denying eligibility based on coverage requirements, penalizing providers for following the act, offering incentives to reduce inpatient stays, or requiring preauthorization for length of stay determination. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" mandates group health plans to cover inpatient stays determined by a physician, prohibits denial based on coverage requirements, penalizes violators, and establishes an appeals process. It also requires compliance with notice requirements under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. Amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 are also included. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include a new section in Subpart B of Part 7 of Title I, mandating coverage for inpatient stays determined by a physician and establishing penalties for non-compliance. Additionally, standards for hospital lengths of stay are outlined in Section 713. Prohibitions include denying eligibility based on coverage requirements, penalizing providers for following the regulations, offering incentives to reduce inpatient stays, and requiring preauthorization for stay length determination. The Secretary will establish an appeals process and penalty for plans or issuers that violate the provisions of this section. A new section, SEC. 2752, establishes standards for hospital lengths of stay in individual health insurance. The provisions of section 2706 apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market as they do in connection with a group health plan. Health insurance issuers must comply with notice requirements under section 713(d) of ERISA. Effective January 1, 1999, amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) apply to plan years. The amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) apply to plan years beginning on or after January 1, 1999. A special rule applies to group health plans maintained under collective bargaining agreements ratified before that date, where the amendments do not apply until the last collective bargaining agreement relating to the plan terminates or January 1, 1999, whichever is later. The amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) apply to plan years beginning on or after January 1, 1999. Amendments for individual market health insurance coverage apply from January 1, 1999.
